arch:property.oc:show_val: 0.40 m in north south width-by-5.12 m in east west length.
Central area of the trench, just above the level of the floor bedding.

Locus 9 is carved from a single threshold block of dark gray sandstone. In the east and west are postholes. The east posthole is in the shape of a square measuring 0.10 m in length by 0.12 m in width by 0.03 m in depth. The west half of this posthole is cut slightly shallower than the east. The west posthole is less well preserved. Rather than being cut into the threshold, the west posthole it is cut next to it. The hole also has an irregular shape (presumably due to the weathering of the west end of the threshold) and measures 0.10 m (west) to 0.24 m (west) in length and 0.18 m in width.

oc:metadata.dc:title: Petra Great Temple Excavations: Locus 9 (Locus)
